sections.title: Overview
sections.content: Iraq is a country located in Western Asia, often referred to as the cradle of civilization. It is home to some of the world’s earliest cities and cultures, including ancient Mesopotamia.

sections.title: Capital City
sections.content: Baghdad is the capital and largest city of Iraq. It has historically been a major center of learning, culture, and trade in the Islamic world.

sections.title: Currency
sections.content: The official currency of Iraq is the Iraqi dinar (IQD).

sections.title: Language
sections.content: The official languages are Arabic and Kurdish. Other languages spoken include Turkmen and Assyrian Neo-Aramaic.

sections.title: Traditional Food
sections.content: Iraqi cuisine is rich and hearty, with popular dishes such as masgouf, dolma, kubba, and biryani.

sections.title: Geography
sections.content: Iraq’s geography includes fertile river valleys formed by the Tigris and Euphrates rivers, deserts in the west, and mountainous regions in the north.

sections.title: Culture
sections.content: Iraqi culture reflects a blend of Arab, Kurdish, and ancient Mesopotamian traditions, with strong emphasis on family, hospitality, poetry, and music.

sections.title: Tourism
sections.content: Tourism sites include ancient cities such as Babylon and Ur, religious shrines in Najaf and Karbala, and historical landmarks in Baghdad.

sections.title: Fun Fact
sections.content: Writing is believed to have first developed in ancient Mesopotamia, located in modern-day Iraq.

history.event: The Sumerians established some of the world’s first cities, including Uruk and Ur.
The Akkadian Empire united much of Mesopotamia under Sargon of Akkad.
The Babylonian Empire flourished under Hammurabi, known for one of the earliest law codes.
The Assyrian Empire rose to power, dominating much of the Near East.
Islamic forces captured Mesopotamia, integrating the region into the Islamic Caliphate.
Baghdad was founded and became the capital of the Abbasid Caliphate.
The Ottoman Empire gained control over Iraq.
Iraq gained independence from British control and became a sovereign state.
A US-led invasion resulted in major political changes in Iraq.
